intro: Malacothrix fendleri, commonly known as the desert hairgrass, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a perennial grass that typically grows in rocky soils and dry, open habitats. The plant has slender, wiry stems and small, narrow leaves that are adapted to conserve water. Its inflorescence consists of a dense cluster of tiny, spikelet-like flowers that bloom in spring. Malacothrix fendleri is notable for its ability to thrive in harsh, low-nutrient environments, making it an important component of desert ecosystems.
